Plot Summary:
The story follows Alfred Butler, a pampered and wealthy young man with no interest in sports, hard work, or confrontation. His family arranges a hunting trip, where he falls in love with a country girl who values strength and masculinity. To impress her and her father, Alfred pretends to be a champion prizefighter coincidentally sharing his last name. The ruse spirals out of control, leading to a series of misunderstandings and comedic chaos. When the real fighter returns, Alfred is pushed into the boxing ring, forced to prove his worth not just with wealth, but with courage. The climax delivers both slapstick hilarity and heartfelt resolution as Alfred fights for love and honor.

metadata.Plot: Alfred's father wants him to make of a man of himself so sends him off on a hunting and fishing trip. He doesn't catch or shoot anything, but he does fall in love with a mountain girl. When her father and brothers laugh at this they are informed that he is Alfred "Battling" Butler, the championship fighter. From there on the masquerade must be maintained.
